item.title: Worldwide Devotional, May 2017
item.description: Elder Kim B. Clark and his wife speak at the Worldwide Devotional for Young Adults, on May 7, 2017.

item.title: Repentance and Charity
item.description: Sister Sue L. Clark talks about repentance and charity during the May 2017 Worldwide Devotional.

item.title: Thou Art Joseph
item.description: Elder Kim B. Clark talks during the May 2017 Worldwide Devotional.

item.title: When Life is Less Than Ideal
item.description: The ideal family situation includes a loving mother, a caring father, obedient children, and harmony in the home. So what can you do when that’s just not the case for your family?

item.title: Parenting Young Adults
item.description: Wendy Ulrich, a mother and licensed psychologist, shares personal stories and insights to help answer questions about raising young adults, which may sometimes be more challenging than parenting young children.

item.title: How to Teach the Joys of Service
item.description: When life feels dark, overwhelming, or lonely, what can we do to find peace? Reaching outside of ourselves to serve others who are also in need may seem counterintuitive, but it is a healing balm that is tried and true.

item.title: How to Talk to Your Kids about Intimacy
item.description: Intimidated by The Talk? Here are ideas on how to talk to your kids about sexual relationships.

item.title: How to Talk to Your Kids about Pornography
item.description: M. Joseph Brough, second counselor in the Young Men general presidency, and Alaina Chatterly, a mental health therapist for teenagers, share personal stories and expert insights to help answer these questions.

item.title: How to Teach Your Child How the Spirit Speaks to Them
item.description: Bonnie H. Cordon, the second counselor in the Primary general presidency, suggests that learning the language of the Spirit is easiest when it starts at home, where children can be immersed in it.

item.title: Fostering Independence in Children
item.description: Jean B. Bingham, first counselor in the Primary general presidency, and author Merrilee Boyack share personal stories and expert insights to help answer these questions in this episode of Gospel Solutions for Families.

item.title: Living Without Guilt When Your Child Chooses a Different Path
item.description: Robin Zenger Baker, author of Finding Peace When a Child Chooses Another Path, has studied psychology, organizational behavior, and family therapy. She shares personal stories and professional insights to answer questions.

item.title: Dealing with Kids Suffering from Anxiety or Depression
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, first counselor in the Young Women General Presidency, and Heather Nelson, a licensed clinical social worker, share personal stories and expert insights to help answer questions in this episode of Gospel Solutions for Families.

item.title: World Report October 2016
item.description: The World Report is a semiannual report of news events around the world pertaining to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Mormons Combating Global Hunger with Donation to World Food Program
item.description: With 65 million refugees worldwide, the Church is committed to alleviating suffering in all its forms, including hunger.

item.title: How the LDS Church is Helping Refugees in Italy
item.description: A brief look at how Mormons are helping refugees in Italy.

item.title: Mormons in Italy Donate Field Kitchen to Italian Red Cross
item.description: Through donations by Mormons each month in what The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints calls fast day, enough money was collected to purchase a mobile kitchen for the Red Cross of Rome.

item.title: Elder Holland Addresses Religious Persecution, Forced Migration at Windsor Conference
item.description: Elder Holland addressed a gathering of humanitarians, scholars, faith and government leaders at a conference at Windsor Castle in the United Kingdom titled “Religious Persecution: The Driver for Forced Migration.”

item.title: Mormon Apostle: Engage in Religious Freedom Debate Constructively
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks encouraged members to get involved “in a constructive way in the vital contest for religious freedom.”

item.title: Bishop W. Christopher Waddell Leads a Recovery Effort After Severe Earthquake in Ecuador
item.description: Bishop Waddell comforts and ministers to earthquake victims during his trip.

item.title: Principles of Self Reliance Embraced by Latter-day Saints in Accra, Ghana
item.description: Principles of Self Reliance Embraced by Latter-day Saints in Accra, Ghana.

item.title: In Louisiana, Mormon Helping Hands Clean Out Flooded Homes
item.description: More than 6,500 volunteers to date from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints assisted with relief efforts in parts of Louisiana damaged by recent record flooding.

item.title: Mormon Tabernacle Choir Returns to Europe after Decades Away Recaptures Iconic Photo
item.description: More than 300 members of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and 65 members of the Orchestra at Temple Square wrap up a seven-city summer tour in western Europe.

item.title: Mormon Temples Update October 2016
item.description: Thomas S. Monson, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, announced plans to build four new temples located in Harare, Zimbabwe; Quito, Ecuador; Belém, Brazil; and Lima, Peru.

item.title: President Eyring Dedicates Philadelphia Mormon Temple
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring, first counselor in the First Presidency, dedicated Pennsylvania’s first temple of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints’ 152nd on Sunday, September 18, 2016.

item.title: University of Utah Names Historic Building After President Monson
item.description: A historic mansion in downtown Salt Lake City has been renamed the Thomas S. Monson Center after the current president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Honors Boy Scouts in California
item.description: The Scout Oath states, “On my honor, I will do my best to do my duty to God.” Elder Holland hopes these words “never become casual or commonplace.”

item.title: Vietnam Grants Official Recognition to LDS Church
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles said, “We express gratitude and appreciation for the official full recognition of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and its representative committee in Vietnam.”

item.title: Council of Fifty Minutes Featured in New Joseph Smith Papers Volume
item.description: A new volume of never-before-published documents offers a candid view on how early Mormon leaders handled the temporal affairs of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Mormon Missionaries and Philanthropist Partner to Rebuild a Cambodian Village
item.description: Mormon missionaries and a philanthropist are partnering to help Cambodians on a former landfill known as “trash mountain.”

item.title: S&I 2015 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Nurturing the Success of a Called Teacher Part 1
item.description: Working with the called teacher from orientation to new teacher training and ongoing teacher training.

item.title: S&I 2015 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Nurturing the Success of a Called Teacher Part 2
item.description: An effective new teacher orientation, and how to use the new teacher training resource.

item.title: SI 2006 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Your Role in Inservice
item.description: Better understand your role as an inservice participant and leader.

item.title: S&I 2006 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - The Purpose of Inservice
item.description: The importance of local inservice and the impact that local inservice can produce.

item.title: S&I 2008 Administrators Round Table - The Standards of Inservice
item.description: The expected standards for inservice within seminaries and institutes

item.title: S&I 2005 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Elements of a Meaningful Inservice
item.description: The five specific elements needed to provide a meaningful inservice.

item.title: S&I 2009 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Preparation
item.description: How preparation improves participation.

item.title: S&I 2009 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Observation
item.description: Key elements in observation.

item.title: S&I 2009 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Feedback
item.description: Giving and receiving feedback.

item.title: S&I 2009 Inservice Leaders Broadcast - Action
item.description: Observation and feedback follow-up.

item.title: Thomas S. Monson, "To the Rescue" (April 2001 General Conference)
item.description: President Monson encourages us to strengthen and lift those we serve.

item.title: Chad H Webb, "Chilean Mine Rescue" (S&I 2010 Global Faculty Meeting, December)
item.description: Brother Webb reviews the 2010 Chilean mining disaster using it as a metaphor for us to help rescue those we serve.

item.title: A Foundation of Faith: 100 Years of Seminary (S&I 2012 Seminary Centennial Broadcast)
item.description: President Eyring shares the story of his mother being on the rolls of seminary and how we need to reach out and bring young people in as someone did for his mother.

item.title: Mervyn B. Arnold, "To the Rescue: We Can Do It" (April 2016 General Conference)
item.description: The Lord has provided all of the tools necessary for us to go to the rescue of our less-active and nonmember friends.

item.title: 1.4.3. Working Together With Priesthood Leaders (Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook)
item.description: Elder Nelson exhorts us to reach out by working closely with priesthood leaders in order to rescue the youth of the church (Russell M. Nelson, "Teaching Youth in the Day of the Wave," S&I August Broadcast, 2013). (1:49)

item.title: 1.4.3 A Junior Partner (Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook)
item.description: Elder Maxwell encourages Seminary and Institute personnel to give special deference to family and priesthood leaders as they all work together for the welfare of the students (Neal A. Maxwell, 'Glorify Christ,' Feb. 2, 2001). (0:43)

item.title: Henry B. Eyring, "Faith and Keys" (October 2004 General Conference)
item.description: President Eyring uses the story of the Teton Dam disaster to teach the importance of priesthood keys.

item.title: Boyd K. Packer, “Equally Yoked Together” (Regional Representatives’ Seminar, April 1975)
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer uses the story of oxen being equally yoked together to teach principles of teamwork.

item.title: Randall Hall, "Maintaining Balance"
item.description: Brother Hall teaches the concept of staying in the middle of the road in our work as he describes the famous Mombasa Highway.

item.title: 1.4.3 Working with Priesthood Leaders to Enroll More Youth (Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook)
item.description: Elder Ballard and Elder Johnson share ideas on how to work well with priesthood leaders (Discussion with M. Russell Ballard, Paul V. Johnson, and Chad H. Webb, S&I Aug. Broadcast, 2010).

item.title: Gary Moore, "Vital Principles for Religious Educators" (CES Satellite Broadcast, August 2007)
item.description: Brother Gary Moore describes several things he would do as an administrator in working with priesthood leaders.

item.title: Acquiring Spiritual Knowledge: Madison’s Story
item.description: A young woman struggles with questions about plural marriage in early Church history and finds understanding as she applies principles of acquiring spiritual knowledge.

item.title: JustServe - BYU TV Documentary 2017
item.description: This 2017 BYU-TV produced documentary highlights benefits that flow when individuals and families search, sign-up for and serve others in their community through JustServe.org.
